intro: Languas dolichocephala, commonly known as the long-headed langua, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features elongated, narrow leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
